channel.title: Vote for Cash system
channel.description:
hey i was wondering, can vote for cash be implemented without the use of a SQL server..
can html/php edit a userfile on a server?

item.title: Vote for Cash system
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

this is something of a base; i do not know how to do this, but this is the perfect way to.

if (command.startsWith("payvote") && playerRights >= 3) { command substring 6 shit here. votePay(); }
starting command.
add a votePay void/class; that starts an MySQL connection with your MySQL host and will send the ip of the player who you entered on substring 6; after he presses the button on your page MySQL will send back to the server that it is done and server will simply.

addItem(995, 200000); sM("thanks for voting, your submission has been accepted.");

Read full topic

item.title: Vote for Cash system
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“asdjf, post:1, topic:341984”]hey i was wondering, can vote for cash be implemented without the use of a SQL server…

can html/php edit a userfile on a server?[/quote]

Ya. All you would have to do is send another “connection” opcode to the server, not 14, then send a hash of the players name, or the players ID to the server, send another few bytes for the amount of money. If the player is online, the server will automatically send the player a message saying “You received X gp for voting.” and then adding X gold to his inventory. If the player’s not online, just have the server update the player file, adding the gp to the inventory.

Read full topic
